template.template: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
template.name: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
template.description:
The template for monitoring Check Point Quantum Next Generation Firewall Security Gateway by SNMP.
MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB CHECKPOINT-MIB UCD-SNMP-MIB SNMPv2-MIB IF-MIB
Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

item.name: ICMP ping
item.description: Host accessibility by ICMP. 0 - ICMP ping fails. 1 - ICMP ping successful.

trigger.expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0
trigger.name: Check Point: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

item.name: ICMP loss
item.description: Percentage of lost packets.

trigger.expression: min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: Check Point: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: Check Point: Unavailable by ICMP ping
dependency.expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0

item.name: ICMP response time
item.description: ICMP ping response time (in seconds).

trigger.expression: avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmppingsec,5m)>{$ICMP_RESPONSE_TIME_WARN}
trigger.name: Check Point: High ICMP ping response time
trigger.description: Average ICMP response time is too high.

dependency.name: Check Point: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

dependency.name: Check Point: Unavailable by ICMP ping
dependency.expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0

item.name: SNMP walk network interfaces
item.description: Used for discovering interfaces from IF-MIB.

item.name: Remote Access users
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of remote access users.

item.name: SNMP walk fan sensors
item.description: Used for discovering fan sensors from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item.name: SNMP walk PSU sensors
item.description: Used for discovering power supply sensors from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item.name: SNMP walk temperature sensors
item.description: Used for discovering temperature sensors from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item.name: SNMP walk voltage sensors
item.description: Used for discovering voltage sensors from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: Used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other `snmptrap` items.

item.name: SNMP walk svn features
item.description: Used for discovering software blades and features from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB Name and contact information of the contact person for the node. If not provided, the value is a zero-length string.

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Average time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU interrupts per second
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of interrupts processed per second.

item.name: Load average (1m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Average number of processes being executed or waiting over the last minute.

item.name: Load average (5m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Average number of processes being executed or waiting over the last 5 minutes.

item.name: Load average (15m avg)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Average number of processes being executed or waiting over the last 15 minutes.

item.name: Number of CPUs
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of processors.

item.name: Context switches per second
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Number of context switches per second.

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Average time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Average time the CPU has spent running user processes that are not niced.

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB CPU utilization per core in %.

trigger.expression: min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/system.cpu.util,5m)>{$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}
trigger.name: Check Point: High CPU utilization
trigger.event_name: Check Point: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item.name: SNMP walk CPU
item.description: Used for discovering CPU from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB Full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating system, and networking software.

item.name: Appliance manufacturer
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Appliance manufacturer.

item.name: Appliance product name
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Appliance product name.

item.name: Appliance serial number
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Appliance serial number.

trigger.expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#1)<>last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber,#2) and length(last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber))>0
trigger.name: Check Point: Device has been replaced
trigger.event_name: Check Point: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: The device serial number has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB Physical location of the node (e.g., `equipment room`, `3rd floor`). If not provided, the value is a zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for the node (the node's fully-qualified domain name). If not provided, the value is a zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: Check Point: System name has changed
trigger.event_name: Check Point: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: The name of the system has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the entity as part of the vendor's SMI enterprises subtree with the prefix 1.3.6.1.4.1 (e.g., a vendor with the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242 might assign a system object with the OID 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1).

item.name: System uptime
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-V2-MIB Time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

trigger.expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/system.uptime)<10m
trigger.name: Check Point: Device has been restarted

item.name: SNMP walk disks
item.description: Used for discovering storage disks from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item.name: Active memory
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Active real memory (memory used by applications that is not cached to the disk) in bytes.

item.name: Free memory
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Free memory available for applications in bytes.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Total real memory in bytes. Memory used by applications.

item.name: Used memory
item.description: Used real memory calculated by total real memory and free real memory in bytes.

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: Memory utilization in %.

trigger.expression: min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vm.memory.util,5m)>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}
trigger.name: Check Point: High memory utilization
trigger.event_name: Check Point: High memory utilization (>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item.name: Decrypted packets per second
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of decrypted packets per second.

item.name: Encrypted packets per second
item.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of encrypted packets per second.

item.name: SNMP walk VPN tunnels
item.description: Used for discovering VPN tunnels from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item.name: SNMP agent availability
item.description:
Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to the availability icons in the host list.
Possible values: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/zabbix[host,snmp,available],{$SNMP.TIMEOUT})=0
trigger.name: Check Point: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

dependency.name: Check Point: Unavailable by ICMP ping
dependency.expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/icmpping,#3)=0

item_prototype.name: CPU Core {#CPU.ID}: CPU idle time
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB The time the CPU `{#CPU.ID}` has spent doing nothing.

item_prototype.name: CPU Core {#CPU.ID}: CPU system time
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB The time the CPU `{#CPU.ID}` has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item_prototype.name: CPU Core {#CPU.ID}: CPU user time
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB The time the CPU `{#CPU.ID}` has spent running user processes that are not niced.

item_prototype.name: CPU Core {#CPU.ID}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB CPU `{#CPU.ID}` utilization in %.

item.host: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP

discovery_rule.name: FAN discovery
discovery_rule.description: For discovering fan sensors from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item_prototype.name: FAN {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Current speed of the fan.

item_prototype.name: FAN {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Current status of the fan tray.

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[fanSpeedSensorStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#3,"eq",1)=3
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[fanSpeedSensorStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#3)=0
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: FAN {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan speed is out of range

item.host: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP

discovery_rule.name: Firewall discovery
discovery_rule.description: This discovery will create a set of firewall metrics from CHECKPOINT-MIB if the firewall is installed.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Accepted packets per second{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of accepted packets per second.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Peak concurrent connections{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Peak number of concurrent connections since last reboot.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Concurrent connections{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of concurrent IPv6 and IPv4 connections.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Dropped packets per second{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of dropped packets per second.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Firewall filter install time{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Last install time of the firewall filter.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Firewall filter name{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Name of the firewall filter.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Logged packets per second{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of logged packets per second.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Rejected packets per second{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of rejected packets per second.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: SIC Trust State{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Firewall SIC Trust State.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Utilized drops number per second{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Number of dropped packets per second due to instance being fully utilized.

trigger_prototype.expression: avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/fw.utilized.drops[fwFullyUtilizedDrops.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$FW.DROPPED.PACKETS.TH}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/fw.utilized.drops[fwFullyUtilizedDrops.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<={$FW.DROPPED.PACKETS.TH}
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Instance is currently fully utilized
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point Firewall: Number of dropped packets has been increased: >{$FW.DROPPED.PACKETS.TH}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses the number of dropped packets, an increase of which indicates that the instance is fully utilized.

item_prototype.name: Check Point Firewall: Firewall version{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Current version of the firewall.

item.host: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces - the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces - the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of `ifInOctets`. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces - the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces - the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of `ifOutOctets`. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system and at other times as indicated by the value of `ifCounterDiscontinuityTime`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n`, then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000` to `n+499,999`. For interfaces that do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The `testing(3)` state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. - If `ifAdminStatus` is `down(2)`, then `ifOperStatus` should be `down(2)`. - If `ifAdminStatus` is changed to `up(1)`, then `ifOperStatus` should change to `up(1)` if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic. - It should change to `dormant(5)` if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection). - It should remain in the `down(2)` state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the `up(1)` state. - It should remain in the `notPresent(6)` state if the interface has missing (typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2 or {$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the interface link status is down. 2. `{$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface link is down. 3. `{TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1` - the trigger fires only if the interface link status was up to "1" sometime before.
WARNING: If closed manually, it will not fire again on the next poll because of `diff`.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for `ifType` are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

dependency.name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2 or {$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.in[ifInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$NET.IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) or avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.out[ifOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$NET.IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.in[ifInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$NET.IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) and avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.out[ifOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$NET.IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage (>{$NET.IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: The utilization of the network interface is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2 or {$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$NET.IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$NET.IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$NET.IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$NET.IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate (>{$NET.IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: It recovers when it is below 80% of the `{$NET.IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}` threshold.

dependency.name: Check Point: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
dependency.recovery_expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2 or {$NET.IF.CONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

item.host: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP

discovery_rule.name: PSU discovery
discovery_rule.description: For discovering power supply sensors from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item_prototype.name: PSU {#SNMPINDEX}: Power supply status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Power supply status.

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[powerSupplyStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#3,"eq",1)=3
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[powerSupplyStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#3)=0
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: PSU {#SNMPINDEX}: Power supply is in down state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors.

discovery_rule.name: Software blades discovery
discovery_rule.description: For discovering software blades and features from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item_prototype.name: {#SW.NAME}: License expiration date
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Expiration date for the license of the software blade. Doesn't return a value if the license doesn't have an expiration date.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$LICENSE.CONTROL:"{#SW.NAME}"}=1 and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/svn.sw.license.exp_date[licensingExpirationDate.{#SNMPINDEX}]) - now()) / 86400 < {$LICENSE.EXPIRY.WARN:"{#SW.NAME}"} and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/svn.sw.license.exp_date[licensingExpirationDate.{#SNMPINDEX}]) > now()
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: {#SW.NAME}: License expires soon
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point: {#SW.NAME}: License expires soon (less than {$LICENSE.EXPIRY.WARN:"{#SW.NAME}"} days)
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the license expires soon. 2. `{$LICENSE.CONTROL:"{#SW.NAME}"}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking the current license as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this license expires.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$LICENSE.CONTROL:"{#SW.NAME}"}=1 and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/svn.sw.license.exp_date[licensingExpirationDate.{#SNMPINDEX}]) < now()
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: {#SW.NAME}: License has been expired
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the license has been expired. 2. `{$LICENSE.CONTROL:"{#SW.NAME}"}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking the current license as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this license is expired.

item_prototype.name: {#SW.NAME}: License total quota
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Total quota amount for the license of the software blade.

item_prototype.name: {#SW.NAME}: License used quota
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Used quota amount for the license of the software blade.

item_prototype.name: {#SW.NAME}: License state
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Current license state of the software blade.

item_prototype.name: {#SW.NAME}: Software blade status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Current software blade status.

discovery_rule.name: Temperature discovery
discovery_rule.description: For discovering temperature sensors from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Current temperature reading in degrees Celsius from the hardware component's temperature sensor.

trigger_prototype.expression: avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.temp.value[tempertureSensorValue.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$TEMP.VALUE.CRIT:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.temp.value[tempertureSensorValue.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$TEMP.VALUE.CRIT:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}-3
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP.VALUE.CRIT:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values.

trigger_prototype.expression: avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.temp.value[tempertureSensorValue.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$TEMP.VALUE.WARN:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.temp.value[tempertureSensorValue.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$TEMP.VALUE.WARN:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}-3
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP.VALUE.WARN:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values.

dependency.name: Check Point: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Temperature is above critical threshold
dependency.expression: avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.temp.value[tempertureSensorValue.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$TEMP.VALUE.CRIT:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}
dependency.recovery_expression: max(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.temp.value[tempertureSensorValue.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$TEMP.VALUE.CRIT:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}-3

trigger_prototype.expression: avg(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.temp.value[tempertureSensorValue.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$TEMP.VALUE.LOW:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: min(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/sensor.temp.value[tempertureSensorValue.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$TEMP.VALUE.LOW:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}+3
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Temperature is too low
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Temperature is too low: <{$TEMP.VALUE.LOW:"{#SENSOR.NAME}"}
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values.

item.host: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP

discovery_rule.name: Storage discovery
discovery_rule.description: For discovering storage disks from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK.NAME}: Available disk space
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Available free disk (not reserved by the OS) in bytes.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK.NAME}: Free disk space
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Free disk capacity in bytes.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK.NAME}: Disk space utilization
item_prototype.description: Space utilization calculated by the free percentage metric `multiDiskFreeTotalPercent`, expressed in %

item_prototype.name: {#DISK.NAME}: Total disk space
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Total disk size in bytes.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK.NAME}: Used disk space
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Amount of disk used in bytes.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[multiDiskUsagePercent.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$DISK.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#DISK.NAME}"} and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[multiDiskSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[multiDiskUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$DISK.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#DISK.NAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: {#DISK.NAME}: Disk space is critically low
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point: {#DISK.NAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$DISK.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#DISK.NAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: 1. The first condition - utilization of the space should be above `{$DISK.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#DISK.NAME}"}`. 2. The second condition should be one of the following: - the disk free space is less than `{$DISK.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#DISK.NAME}"}`; - the disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[multiDiskUsagePercent.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$DISK.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#DISK.NAME}"} and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[multiDiskSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[multiDiskUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$DISK.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#DISK.NAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: {#DISK.NAME}: Disk space is low
trigger_prototype.event_name: Check Point: {#DISK.NAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$DISK.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#DISK.NAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: 1. The first condition - utilization of the space should be above `{$DISK.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#DISK.NAME}"}`. 2. The second condition should be one of the following: - the disk free space is less than `{$DISK.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#DISK.NAME}"}`; - the disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: Check Point: {#DISK.NAME}: Disk space is critically low
dependency.expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.pused[multiDiskUsagePercent.{#SNMPINDEX}])>{$DISK.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#DISK.NAME}"} and (last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.total[multiDiskSize.{#SNMPINDEX}])-last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vfs.fs.used[multiDiskUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}]))<{$DISK.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#DISK.NAME}"}

item.host: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP
Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP

discovery_rule.name: Voltage discovery
discovery_rule.description: For discovering voltage sensors from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item_prototype.name: {#SENSOR.NAME}: Voltage value
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Most recent measurement obtained by the agent for this sensor.

item.host: Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP

discovery_rule.name: VPN discovery
discovery_rule.description: For discovering VPN tunnels from CHECKPOINT-MIB.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Community
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB VPN tunnel community.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Tunnel interface
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB VPN tunnel interface.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Peer IP address
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB VPN peer IP address.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Peer type
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB VPN peer type.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Link priority
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Link priority.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Probing state
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB VPN tunnel probing state: 0 - unknown 1 - alive 2 - dead

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Source IP
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB Source IP address.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Tunnel state
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB VPN tunnel state: 3 - active 4 - destroy 129 - idle 130 - phase1 131 - down 132 - init

trigger_prototype.expression: {$VPN.STATE.CONTROL:"{#VPN.NAME}"}=1 and last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vpn.tunnel.state[tunnelState.{#SNMPINDEX}])=131
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: last(/Check Point Next Generation Firewall by SNMP/vpn.tunnel.state[tunnelState.{#SNMPINDEX}])=3 or {$VPN.STATE.CONTROL:"{#VPN.NAME}"}=0
trigger_prototype.name: Check Point: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Tunnel down
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. It can be triggered if the current tunnel state is down. 2. `{$VPN.STATE.CONTROL:"{#VPN.NAME}"}=1` - a user can redefine the context macro to "0", marking this notification as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this tunnel is down.

item_prototype.name: VPN {#VPN.NAME}: Tunnel type
item_prototype.description: MIB: CHECKPOINT-MIB VPN tunnel type.

Number of days until the license expires.
Load per CPU considered sustainable. Change if needed.
